alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 10:08PM MST until July 26 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Graham. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen between Safford and Solomon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Safford, Solomon, Safford Regional Airport and Roper Lake State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
